/work/doc/pages/Scheduler.md
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 \defgroup scheduler Scheduling Sessions for Automatic Connection
2 \ingroup advanced-programming
3 
4 \details
5 
6 \section session-scheduler-brief Sessions Scheduler
7 
8 The Sessions Scheduler service cat automatically connect sessions to
9 the counterparty at the beginning of the trading day, keep a session connected for
10 the entire trading day, and disconnect it at the end of the last trading day.
11 
12 \section session-scheduler-class SessionScheduler class
13 
14 The OnixS::B3::BOE::Scheduling::SessionScheduler is the main class of the Sessions
15 Scheduling services.
16 
17 \section registering-session-for-automatic-connection Registering a Session for Automatic Connection
18 
19 The OnixS::B3::BOE::Scheduling::SessionScheduler::add member schedules a session for automatic
20 logon and logout according to the specified session time, that can be given to
21 the Scheduler as an instance of the OnixS::B3::BOE::Scheduling::SessionSchedule class, or as an id of the predefined
22 schedule.
23 
24 The OnixS::B3::BOE::Scheduling::SessionConnectionSettings argument specifies the connection settings.
25 
26 \note
27 If the session is being registered between the scheduled logon and logout time, the Scheduler will connect the session
28 immediately.
29 
30 \section unregistering-session-for-automatic-connection Removing Session from Scheduler
31 
32 The OnixS::B3::BOE::Scheduling::SessionScheduler::remove method removes the given session from the scheduling services.
33 
34 \note
35 OnixS::B3::BOE::Scheduling::SessionScheduler::remove does not disconnect an active session. Therefore, if the session
36 has already
37 been connected by the Scheduler, it remains connected after unregistering.
38 
39 \section scheduler-event-handling Handling Scheduling Warnings and Errors
40 
41 The Scheduler exposes the OnixS::B3::BOE::Scheduling::SessionSchedulerListener
42 class to notify about errors in the session schedule.
43 
44 The Scheduler calls the OnixS::B3::BOE::Scheduling::SessionSchedulerListener::onWarning member to notify about
45 non-critical issues.
46 
47 \section scheduling-rules Scheduling Rules
48 
49 - If the session is registered between the scheduled logon and logout time, the Scheduler will connect the session
50 immediately.
51 - If the session is registered after the logout and before the logon time, the Scheduler will make no attempts to
52 connect the session
53  until the next logon time.
54 - If the session is registered after the logout and before the logon time, and the session is in an active state, it
55 will be disconnected immediately.
56 - In case of a logon failure, the Scheduler tries to logon again per its reconnection settings
57 (OnixS::B3::BOE::Scheduling::SessionScheduler::reconnectAttempts and
58 OnixS::B3::BOE::Scheduling::SessionScheduler::reconnectInterval).
59 - In the Handler detects a network error, it tries to restore the connection per the
60  Session configuration (OnixS::B3::BOE::Session::reconnectAttempts and OnixS::B3::BOE::Session::reconnectInterval).
61 - In the exchange disconnect the session during the active windows, the Scheduler tries to connect the session again
62 immediately without delay.
63 - If the Scheduler connects the session within reconnection attempts defined by the Session configuration, it does not
64 report an error.
65 - If the session is still in the OnixS::B3::BOE::SessionStateId::Reconnecting state and the logout time is reached,
66  the Scheduler will stop the reconnect attempts, and will not report an error.
67 - If the session remains disconnected after all reconnect attempts, the
68 OnixS::B3::BOE::Scheduling::SessionSchedulerListener::onError method will be called.
69 - Once the Scheduler calls the OnixS::B3::BOE::Scheduling::SessionSchedulerListener::onError method, it stops all
70 attempts
71  to connect the session until the next logon time.
72

74

76
